channel.title: [TUT] Data Types
channel.description:
[b]String:[/b] This is a sequence of up to around 2 billion characters.
[b]Integer:[/b] This is a whole number from -32,768 to 32,767.
[b]Long:[/b] This is a whole number from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.
[b]Single:[/b] A floating point data type which holds positive or negative numbers up to around 3.4 E38.
[b]Double:[/b] A floating-point data type like single but holding positive or numbers to around 1.8 E308.
[b]Currency:[/b] This data type is called a scaled integer because it deals with fixed-point numbers that have 15 digits to the left of the decimal point and 4 digits to the right. This is more accurate than floating-point numbers for currency values.
[b]Date:[/b] Holds dates from January 1st 100 to December 31st 9999. Time information is also stored.
[b]Boolean:[/b] This is the simplest data type. It has just two possible values, True and False.
[b]Byte:[/b] This data type holds positive numbers from 0 to 255.
[b]Object:[/b] The object data type stores Visual Basic objects. These can also be automation objects from other applications.

item.title: [TUT] Data Types
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I never heard of the date data type, thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: [TUT] Data Types
item.dc:creator: @hellou hellou
item.description:
@hellou wrote:

String: This is a sequence of up to around 2 billion characters.

Integer: This is a whole number from -32,768 to 32,767.

Long: This is a whole number from -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.

Single: A floating point data type which holds positive or negative numbers up to around 3.4 E38.

Double: A floating-point data type like single but holding positive or numbers to around 1.8 E308.

Currency: This data type is called a scaled integer because it deals with fixed-point numbers that have 15 digits to the left of the decimal point and 4 digits to the right. This is more accurate than floating-point numbers for currency values.

Date: Holds dates from January 1st 100 to December 31st 9999. Time information is also stored.

Boolean: This is the simplest data type. It has just two possible values, True and False.

Byte: This data type holds positive numbers from 0 to 255.

Object: The object data type stores Visual Basic objects. These can also be automation objects from other applications.
